meanings.definition: The amount that can be held in one hand with the fingers closed
meanings.sent1: She picked up fistfuls of colorful candies at the store.
meanings.sent2: He grabbed fistfuls of sand and let it slip through his fingers.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought it was funny to throw fistfuls of food on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like fistfuls of joy.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sunset painted the sky with fistfuls of orange and pink.

meanings.sent1: The old man carried only a few fistfuls of coins in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: She had to make do with just a couple of fistfuls of flour for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the toy, batting it around in fistfuls of excitement.
meanings.sent4: His words hit her heart in fistfuls of pain.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with fistfuls of warmth.
